7.Pros: Overall a good job, worked my way up from crew to manager. Made a lot of friends and enjoyed work most of the time.
7.Cons: The pay is barely liveable and usually you have to do at least two overnights a week. You're also first to get chewed out if anything goes wrong

8.Pros: -the processes are very easy to learn and the education is standardized-there is room for internal growth-clean environment
8.Cons: -not as flexible with work schedules-sometimes understaffed, work load gets unevenly distributed and can get frustrated as an employee

9.Pros: They have great benefits especially if your a business major student they will pay 75% of your tuition. If you're a high school student they will work around your school schedule. Over all if you're a student they pretty much take care of you.
9.Cons: Management at this company sucked. It's a good place to learn a lot about going into management but the pay sucked. The work don't match the pay at all. Your lucky if you have a great general manager but if you don't your going to be over worked and not enough pay.
